hedline.hl1: If the Shoe Doesn't Fit ... Make It

abstract.p: Lorraine Bracco admires pair of $2,400 shoes at Manolo Blahnik, New York City, for her character on television program The Sopranos; HBO representative says costume designer must approve purchase (S)

block.p: A few days earlier, Ms. Falco's ''Sopranos'' co-star Lorraine Bracco could also be found at a favorite sale of the well-dressed -- the semi-annual Manolo Blahnik clearance in Manhattan. There, frenzied women with size 7 feet convince themselves they can fit into a 6 so they can go home with pink and white mules at $150 a pair.

Ms. Bracco, who had been on ''The View'' that day, was perusing the ''not on sale'' shelves when she came upon a pair for her character, Dr. Jennifer Melfi, psychologist to Tony Soprano. ''These are shrink shoes,'' she said as she inspected her feet in a pair of brown alligator pumps for $2,400. When a shopper pointed out that a shoe made from a reptile might offend a patient, Ms. Bracco said, ''I don't care in my own life, and I certainly don't care for my character.''
